<table border="0" width="100%"> <tbody> <tr> <td align="center" rowspan="2"> <a href="index.html"><img border="0" alt="Figure 12.3 Temple Of Inlined Arches" title="Figure 12.3 Temple Of Inlined Arches" hspace="10" src="_viewpoints/Figure12_3TempleOfInlinedArches.x3d._VP_Temple-estuous_aggregation_of_arches.png" width="156" height="89" align="middle"/></a> </td> <td align="left"> <p> Inline nodes can load other VRML/X3D scenes into the current scene, helping authors reuse models to build larger worlds. </p> <p> An Inline node creates a special group from another scene's contents. Children nodes are read from the file selected by a URL, and every child node loaded from the group is displayed. </p> <p> These X3D scenes are adapted directly from the <a href="http://www.wiley.com/legacy/compbooks/vrml2sbk/toc/ch12.htm" target="_Vrml2Sourcebook">original VRML 2.0 Sourcebook chapter examples</a>. Also available: <a href="http://www.sdsc.edu/~moreland/courses/Siggraph98/vrml97/slides/mt0096.htm" target="_Vrml2SourcebookCourse">Introduction to VRML97 SIGGRAPH98 course notes</a>. </p> </td> </tr> </tbody> </table>
